page.title: 14STORNOWAY S. SHERRIFF COURT
page.content: The Sherriff Court is 100-120 years old. There are three people employed there full time; a procurator fiscal, a clerkess and a sherriff clerk. The court assembles about five times a month, three times the first fortnight and two times the next fortnight. In 1780 the first sherriff was appointed and most of the legal work was carried out in what was called the Town House or toll booth. The procurator fiscal is the local prosecuter and the present fiscal has been in office since 1969. The largest fine so far was Â£20,000 for illegal fishing.In 1985. About 80% of crimes dealt with by the court are related to road traffic offences. The other 20% are largely made up of breaches of the peace and assaults.
